repnme.cdata!:
St. Lucia - Water Supply Infrastructure
            Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Water Supply
            Infrastructure Improvement Project for St. Lucia were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was highly
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: the Bank tried to minimize
            the risk of dispersed focus and efforts by staffing the Bank
            teams assigned to both projects to overlap and advise the
            Government of St Lucia (GoSL) as one seamless team. This
            should have been replicated at the local level by having one
            single Project Implementation Unit (PIU) coordinating with
            all water sector stakeholders; an alternative that can be
            explored to maximize Bank's assistance, noting that
            this is not always possible as funding availability and
            timing is a constraint, particularly in International
            Development Association (IDA) countries, is a programmatic
            and wider sector approach, combining technical assistance
            (TA) and investment with clear links and objective
            milestones in terms of performance to access the financing
            under the program; given the lack of real linkages (in terms
            of financing) between the two operations, the results
            monitoring framework of the investment project could have
            considered performance indicators only related to the
            implementation of the investment project financed by the
            loan and credits, i.e. within its control and influence; in
            hindsight, considering that the Private Sector Participation
            (PSP) eventually did not go through, the project as a
            standalone project could have considered alternative routes
            for the institutional strengthening of Water and Sewerage
            Company Inc. (WASCO) vis-a-vis the sustainability of the
            services and investments in its risk analysis and proposed
            mitigation measures.

repnme.cdata!:
Saint Lucia - Water Supply Infrastructure
            Improvement Project - Additional Financing

abstracts.cdata!:
This Project Paper seeks the approval of
            the Executive Directors to provide Additional Financing to
            the Government of Saint Lucia, to be funded with equivalent
            amounts of IDA credits and to be used for the Water Supply
            Infrastructure Improvement Project. The reasons for the
            request for additional financing are: the actual cost of the
            bids received for the turnkey contract; contingencies
            recommended by the technical consultants to the project; and
            an increase in fuel and construction costs since the
            original project appraisal estimates. The additional
            financing request does not entail changes to the
            Project's objectives. The overall scope of the project
            to be financed with IBRD and IDA funds (including the
            additional financing) remains the same as defined in the
            PAD. The project supports the Government of Saint
            Lucia's agenda for the water sector, which establishes
            as a priority the provision of reliable service to meet
            demand from population as well as to facilitate investment
            from hoteliers and developers in the north region. The
            project has two components: (i) Infrastructure Improvement
            Works; and (ii) Technical Assistance and Project Management.

repnme.cdata!:
St. Lucia - Water Supply Infrastructure
            Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Saint Lucia Water Supply
            Infrastructure Improvement Project will support a short term
            investment program to carry out critical works, required to
            achieve the following objectives: a) alleviate the water
            shortage in the north of the country. The infrastructure
            works proposed will allow the utility to supply the entire
            north of the island with a more efficient, continuous and
            reliable service; b) implement urgent investments that will
            result in additional revenues, reduce the likelihood of
            commercial users (important sources of cross-subsidy for
            poor consumers) abandoning the system, and improve the
            potential of a successful partnership between the government
            and the private sector. The Infrastructure Improvement Works
            component includes the upgrade the Roseau dam pumping
            station; improvements to the raw water transmission between
            Vanard and Sarot; upgrade of the Theobalds water treatment
            plant; and, upgrade o f the Morne Bocage distribution
            pipeline. Due to the urgent nature of the works, and the
            close inter-relationship among the project components, it is
            considered that a turnkey contract will be the most
            efficient way to implement this type of project, and achieve
            success.  The second component - Technical Assistance and
            Project Management - includes the provision of technical
            assistance required to support Project implementation, carry
            out Project management activities, and strengthen the
            capacity of the Project Implementation Unit (PlU) staff in
            Project management, and priority technical areas, which may
            include the provision of training. The areas of technical
            assistance include: 1) oversight and monitoring of the
            quality of works; 2) studies on the water resources of the
            Roseau River, including analyses of a) the hydrological
            capacity of the Roseau dam and reservoir system, and
            possibly of other surface water sources, b) the potential
            for increasing the capacity of the Roseau dam through
            engineering improvements, and, c) safety and environmental
            considerations related to such activities; and,
            implementation of a groundwater resources study to determine
            the quantity, quality and potential use of groundwater in
            St. Lucia.

repnme.cdata!:
Saint Lucia - Water Supply Infrastructure
            Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Saint
            Lucia - Water Supply Infrastructure Improvement Project is
            to alleviate the urgent need to improve the availability of
            good quality drinking water in the northern section of the
            island. Current inadequacies of the distribution system
            coupled with the demands for growth in the region are
            placing increasing pressure on the distribution system. This
            environmental assessment (EA) presents environmental impacts
            expected : potential soil erosion; interdiction of public
            roadways; contamination of work sites with fuels and
            hazardous materials; pollution from construction wastes;
            noise from construction activities; dust control issues;
            cultural historical sites; standing water and disease vector
            production. Some of the mitigation measures are :
            development plans for : site stabilization and erosion
            control; traffic management; construction waste management;
            oil and hazardous materials management; and workers
            sanitation plan. For dust control wet roads with water;
            prohibit long-term accumulation of standing water suitable
            for mosquito reproduction; identify lands where crops will
            be removed for construction and negotiate with farmer and
            pay appropriate compensation; and finally. Dispose of fuels
            and used containers in accordance with St. Lucia's law
